summary_1.position: ASSOCIATE SENIOR LECTURER (TENURE TRACK) in AI for SOFTWARE ENGINEERING
summary_1.research_focus: Using and developing (generative) AI to improve software development processes and quality of software artefacts.
responsibilities: Research, teaching, and supervision in software engineering.
Leading and developing the department's research and educational activities.
Conducting lectures and practical elements at undergraduate and graduate levels.
Supervision of degree and project work, and opportunity to supervise doctoral students.
summary_1.collaboration: Part of the strategic research area in IT and mobile communication, ELLIIT.

eligibility.qualifications: Completed a doctoral degree or has equivalent scientific competence.
eligibility.preference: Candidates awarded a doctoral degree or equivalent no more than five years prior to the application deadline.
eligibility.special_considerations: Consideration for earlier qualifications if significant reasons exist (e.g., illness, parental leave).

summary_2.event: Tenure track position in software engineering

excursion_dinner.description: Free for all registered participants of JELIA 2025. Others have to pay 60 Euros

summary_4.description: An international forum for researchers and practitioners to present and discuss recent innovations, trends, results, experiences, and concerns in Information Technology & Systems.

submission_details.review_process: All submitted papers will undergo a double-blind review.

English_papers.format: Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems series
English_papers.identification: No identifying information included in the initial submission.

Spanish_Portuguese_papers.format: RISTI - Revista Ibérica de Sistemas e Tecnologias de Informação
Spanish_Portuguese_papers.identification: No identifying information included in the initial submission.

call_for_papers.description: Invitation for high-quality, original, and unpublished research papers. Topics of interest include software analysis, evolution, and reengineering, covering various areas such as AI for Software Engineering, software maintenance, program comprehension, software visualization, and more.

submission_instructions.peer_review_process: All submissions will undergo rigorous peer review based on originality, quality, soundness, and relevance.
format_requirements: Conform to IEEE Conference Proceedings Formatting Guidelines

track_requirements.Research Track: Max 12 pages (last 2 pages for references only)
track_requirements.Industrial Papers Track: Max 12 pages (last 2 for references only) for full papers; talk proposals max 2 pages
track_requirements.Short Papers and Posters Track: Max 6 pages (including all text, figures, references, and appendices); posters max 2 pages
track_requirements.Early Research Achievement (ERA) Track: Max 6 pages (last 1 page for references only)
track_requirements.Reproducibility Studies and Negative Res: Max 5 pages for appendices; max 12 pages for new reproducibility studies
track_requirements.Registered Report Track: Max 7 pages (last 1 page for references only)

submission_instructions.double_anonymous_review: Applicable to Research, Short Papers and Posters, ERA, and RENE Tracks

call_for_papers.special_journal_issue: Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit revised versions for a special issue in Springer's Empirical Software Engineering Journal.

workshop_information.description: Proposals for workshops highlighting specific topics related to the conference themes are being solicited.
organization_requirements: Provide a link to the workshop website

tutorial_information.description: Proposals for insightful tutorials on software analysis, evolution, and reengineering.

organizing_committee.Local Organizing Chair: George Angelos Papadopoulos, University of Cyprus, Cyprus
Program Chairs: Eunjong Choi, Kyoto Institute of Technology, Japan

summary_6.note: Opportunity to share with potential candidates

program_highlights: Cutting-edge research on software evolution, maintenance, and analysis
Invited keynotes by international thought leaders
Panels, tool demos, and community activities
Networking opportunities with global researchers, practitioners, and students
Conference reception and cultural activities in Auckland

student_volunteers.description: Opportunity to get involved, meet mentors, and experience the conference from the inside.

travel_support.availability: Travel support for US-based attendees available via NSF funding.

logistics_and_sustainability.discount_codes: Available for nearby hotels and international travel upon registration.
logistics_and_sustainability.accessibility: Arrangements being made for inclusivity of all attendees.

networking_opportunity.engagement_with_researchers: Attendees can connect with NZ's software engineering researchers.

summary_7.sponsors: IEEE Computer Society, support from IEEE TCSE and various research organizations

main_activities_responsibilities: Investigate, characterise, and develop ontologies of software vulnerabilities in the edge computing environment.
Monitor and analyze source code, software behaviors, and environmental factors to identify potential vulnerabilities and assess impacts.
Predict or identify vulnerabilities early to enable quick and effective fixes, preventing exploitation.
Investigate software quality certification against cyber disturbances and attacks in a federated/distributed EC environment.
Identify quality issues with AI model implementations on edge and offer strategies for mitigation.

candidate_requirements.education: PhD degree in Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, or Computer Science
research_experience: Experience in Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, Edge Computing, and/or Cybersecurity.
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks like PyTorch, Keras, or TensorFlow.
Solid understanding of edge intelligence and software vulnerabilities.
Effective collaboration within a research team.
Strong publication record relevant to career stage.

summary_8.contract_duration: 2 years, with potential for renewal or permanence based on funding.
benefits: Holiday entitlement of up to 8.4 weeks per year
Wellbeing support including flexible working options and mental health initiatives
summary_8.equality_commitment: Queen's University promotes equality of opportunity and subscribes to various equality charters.
summary_8.visa_information: International applicants should assess their eligibility for a visa via the university's website.

call_for_papers.originality_policy: Submit original material owned by authors, not under review elsewhere

summary_9.community_invitation: Join the AIxSE community for announcements and notifications

calls.theme: Architecting in Continuous Software Engineering: Evolving Roles, Enduring Principles

calls.focus: Context-driven solutions tailored to specific domains or organizations

workshop_proposals.details: Propose a workshop to discuss emerging trends and research in software architecture.

summary_11.closing_statement: We look forward to your contributions and hope to see you in Amsterdam!

special_issue.focus: The special issue will focus on the impact of Agentic AI on software engineering, including various branches such as coding, testing, analysis, patching, documentation, and design.

tracks: Track 1: Large Language Models (LLMs) in the Metaverse
Track 2: Native AI for Metaverse Technologies

manuscript_length.camera_ready: maximum of 8 pages, subject to an overlength page fee

call_for_contributions.scope: The book addresses the complexity of modern engineering challenges and the interdisciplinary field of System of Systems Engineering (SoSE), including its applications across industries such as aerospace, healthcare, and energy.

key_topics.theme: Foundations of System of Systems Engineering

subtopics: Human factors in design and operation

submission_guidelines.requirements: Original, unpublished contributions not under review elsewhere.

positions.domain: Software engineering, Programming systems and languages, Software dependability including formal methods
Software engineering, Programming systems and languages, Software dependability including formal methods
Software security and cybersecurity, including system security, cyber-physical systems security, AI for security & security for AI, privacy, distributed systems security

summary_18.seniority_levels: Open to all seniority levels (assistant/associate or full)
